title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest's No. 55 jersey became an iconic symbol at USC, following a tradition started by Junior Seau.
McGinest retained No. 55 in the NFL, playing for the New England Patriots from 1994-2005, winning three Super Bowls.
Junior Seau wore No. 55 for the Patriots after McGinest left, continuing the jersey's legacy and significance.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County experienced the highest snowfall, with several locations recording over 10 inches in the Feb. 7, 2026 storm.
New England snow observers and the National Weather Service provided detailed snowfall data for various Massachusetts towns.
Bristol County reported significant snowfall too, with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches, one of the highest amounts in the region.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC as the Patriots face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Tirico will transition from Super Bowl coverage to hosting NBC's Olympic studio program from Levi's Stadium.
Tirico joins analyst Cris Collinsworth, sideline reporters Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung, and host Maria Taylor for coverage.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs for Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium.
Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest to win a Super Bowl, beating Dan Marino's age record.
The Seahawks led the NFL in scoring defense this season, allowing 17.2 points per game, while Patriots averaged 28.8 points.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid before coaching his first Super Bowl with the Patriots.
Vrabel also relied on offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, who has participated in 10 Super Bowls.
Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season after prior four-win seasons, earning Coach of the Year honors.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: A Patriots win on Sunday would give them a record-breaking seventh Super Bowl title, surpassing the Pittsburgh Steelers.
Drake Maye could become the first quarterback to win a Super Bowl in his second year since Russell Wilson in 2014.
Mike Vrabel aims to be the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs expresses desire for Hall of Fame induction, hoping a Super Bowl LX win will bolster his case.
Diggs has been a Pro Bowler four times and has two All-Pro nods, potentially impacting Hall of Fame chances.
Diggs ranks 38th in all-time receiving yards with 11,504 and 43rd in touchdowns, aiming for top-15 finishes.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots and scored the most points in NFL history, 2,673.
Vinatieri's iconic moments include the game-winning field goals in Super Bowls XXXVI and XXXVIII for the Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel prepared the Patriots for a longer Super Bowl halftime by simulating the break during practice.
Injured Patriots Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited in practice; both aim to play in the Super Bowl.
Quarterback Drake Maye fully participated in practice, overcoming a shoulder issue, and was among the last to leave the field.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye and Sam Darnold face off as former No. 3 picks in Super Bowl LX for Patriots and Seahawks.
Patriots' defense, led by Milton Williams, has allowed just 8.7 points per game in the postseason.
Seahawks receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba caught 119 passes for 1,793 yards and 10 touchdowns this season.
